Action.Name: KeyBind.BindGroup
Action.Description: Binds a group of specified keys at once.

Arg.Name: Source Table
Arg.Description: The numerically-indexed table containing subtables with each of the keys and their properties.

Arg.Name: Key Table
Arg.Description: The name of the key table upon which this action will be executed.

Arg.Name: Key
Arg.Description: The key code number of the key that will be bound.

Arg.Name: Text
Arg.Description: This is a short description of the key's action.

Arg.Name: Description
Arg.Description: This is the long description of the key's action.
Arg.Default: "Used by engineers to clear mines from a battlefield"

EasyMode.Default: "Used by engineers to clear mines from a battlefield"

Arg.Name: Shift
Arg.Description: Requires the Shift modifier.

Arg.Name: Ctrl
Arg.Description: Requires the Ctrl modifier.

Arg.Name: Alt
Arg.Description: Requireds the Alt modifier.

Arg.Name: Script
Arg.Description: The script that will be executed when the key (or key combination) is pressed.

Arg.Name: Key Table
Arg.Description: The name of the key table upon which this action will be executed.

Action.Name: KeyBind.DeleteKeyBinding
Action.Description: Deletes a key binding from a key table.

Arg.Name: Key
Arg.Description: The key code number of the key that will be deleted.

Arg.Name: Key Table
Arg.Description: The name of the key table upon which the action will be executed.

Action.Name: KeyBind.DeleteKeyTable
Action.Description: Deletes an entire set of keys and their key table at once.

Arg.Name: Key Table
Arg.Description: The name of the key table to delete.

Action.Name: KeyBind.GetKey
Action.Description: Gets the properties of the specified key.

Arg.Name: Key
Arg.Description: The key code number of the key whose attributes are being requested.

Arg.Name: Key Table
Arg.Description: The name of the key table upon which this action will be executed.

Action.Name: KeyBind.GetKeyCode
Action.Description: Gets the key code given the key name.

Arg.Name: Key Name
Arg.Description: The name of the key whose code is being requested.

Action.Name: KeyBind.GetKeyCount
Action.Description: Gets the count of key bindings in a key table.

Arg.Name: Key Table
Arg.Description: The name of the key table for which to count the keys.

Action.Name: KeyBind.GetKeyName
Action.Description: Gets the key name given the key code.

Arg.Name: Key
Arg.Description: The key code number of the key whose name is being requested.

Action.Name: KeyBind.GetKeyTableCount
Action.Description: Gets the total number of key tables.

Action.Name: KeyBind.GetKeyTableNames
Action.Description: Gets the names of all key tables.

Action.Name: KeyBind.KeyIsBound
Action.Description: Determines whether or not a key is bound to a specific key table..

Arg.Name: Key
Arg.Description: The key code number of the key whose bound status is being requested.

Arg.Name: Key Table
Arg.Description: The name of the key table upon which the action will be executed.

Action.Name: KeyBind.KeyTableDoesExist
Action.Description: Detrmines whether or not a specific key table exists.

Arg.Name: Key Table
Arg.Description: The name of the key table whose existence is being confirmed.

Action.Name: KeyBind.LoadSettings
Action.Description: Loads key binding settings from a file.

Arg.Name: File
Arg.Description: The full path to the key bindings file.

Arg.Name: Source Key Table
Arg.Description: The name of the key table which will be loaded from the settings file.

Arg.Name: Target Key Table
Arg.Description: The name of the key table which will adopt the loaded key settings.

Arg.Name: Decryption Key
Arg.Description: The string that will be used to decrypt the code portion of the key attributes.

Action.Name: KeyBind.OnKey
Action.Description: Executes code for all key tables and key bindings.

Arg.Name: e_Key
Arg.Description: The arguement passed to the program when a key is pressed.

Arg.Name: e_Modifiers
Arg.Description: The arguement passed to the program when a modifier is pressed.

Arg.Name: Key Table
Arg.Description: The name of the key table which will be referenced when a key or key combination is pressed.

Action.Name: KeyBind.SaveSettings
Action.Description: Saves key binding settings to a file for later recall.

Arg.Name: File
Arg.Description: The full path to where the file will be saved.

Arg.Name: Key Table
Arg.Description: The name of the key table whose key data will be saved.

Arg.Name: Encryption Key
Arg.Description: The string that will be used to encrypt the code portion of the key attributes.

Action.Name: KeyBind.SetKeyAtt
Action.Description: Sets attributes for an existing key binding.

Arg.Name: Key
Arg.Description: The key code number of the key whose attributes are being requested.

Arg.Name: Text
Arg.Description: This is a short description of the key's action.

Arg.Name: Description
Arg.Description: This is a long description of the key's action.

Arg.Name: Shift
Arg.Description: Requires the Shift modifier.

Arg.Name: Ctrl
Arg.Description: Requires the Ctrl modifier.

Arg.Name: Alt
Arg.Description: Requires the Alt modifier.

Arg.Name: Script
Arg.Description: The script that will be executed when the key (or key combination) is pressed.

Arg.Name: Key Table
Arg.Description: The name of the key table upon which the action will be executed.

Action.Name: KeyBind.UpdateGrid
Action.Description: Displays key binding settings in a grid object.

Arg.Name: Object
Arg.Description: The name of the grid object upon which the key data will be displayed.

Arg.Name: Include Description
Arg.Description: Whether or not to include each key's desciption attribute on the grid.

Arg.Name: ResizeMode
Arg.Description: How each column in the grid will be resized.

Arg.Name: Key Table
Arg.Description: The name of the key table to load into the grid.

Action.ReturnValueDescription: -1 : The specified key is not supported or does not exist 0 : Action was successful

Arg.Note: See KeyBind.BindKey() for specifics on how to create a single key binding.
Set this to "" or nil to use the default key table.

Action.ReturnValueDescription: -1 : The specified key is not supported or does not exist 0 : Action was successful
Action.Example: local sCode = "Dialog.Message(\"Success\", \"Mine Cleared\");" KeyBind.BindKey(KeyBind.Key.M, "Clear Mines", "This ability is used by engineers to clear mines from the battlefield", false, false, false, sCode);

Arg.Note: Not required.
Not required.
Not required. This is false by default.
Not required. This is false by default.
Not required. This is false by default.
Not required but recommended.
Set this to "" or nil to use the default key table.

Action.ReturnValueDescription: -3 : The specified key is unbound -2 : The specified key table does not exist or is empty -1 : The specified key is not supported or does not exist 0 : Action was successful

Arg.Note: Set this to "" or nil to use the default key table.

Action.ReturnValueDescription: -2 : The specified key table does not exist or is empty 0 : Action was successful

-3 : The specified key is unbound -1 : The specified key is not supported or does not exist
When the action is successful, a table is returned which contains the key's attributes. The table is indexed by the following. Key Name Text Desc Shift Ctrl Alt Script

Arg.Note: Set this to "" or nil to use the default key table.

Action.ReturnValueDescription: -1 : The specified key is not supported or does not exist If the action is successful then the key code is returned
-2 : The specified key table does not exist or is empty If the action is successful then the number of keys in the specifed table is returned.

Arg.Note: Set this to "" or nil to use the default key table.

Action.ReturnValueDescription: -1 : The specified key is not supported or does not exist If the action is succesful then the name of the key is returned.
Returns the number of key tables.
Returns a numerically indexed table containing the names of the key tables. If an error occurs or no tables exist then nil is returned.
-1 : The specified key is not supported or does not exist Returns true if the key is bound to the specifed table and false if it is not.

Arg.Note: Set this to "" or nil to use the default key table.

Action.ReturnValueDescription: Returns true if the table exist and false if it does not.
-6 : The specified source table section does not exist, is empty or is corrupt -5 : File does not exist 0 : Action was successful

Arg.Note: This file will have been created by the KeyBind.SaveSettings() function.
Set this to "" or nil to use the default key table.
Set this to "" or nil to use the default key table.
Set this to "" or nil to ignore the decryption process.

Action.ReturnValueDescription: -1 : The specified key is not supported or does not exist
Action.Note: This must be placed in the On Key event of the page, dialog, object or project.

Arg.Note: DO NOT change this argument.
DO NOT change this argument.
Set this to "" or nil to use the default key table.

Action.ReturnValueDescription: 0 : Action was successful If a file error occurs then the error code is returned.

Arg.Note: The file need not exist prior to saving.
Set this to "" or nil to use the default key table.
Set this to "" or nil to ignore the encryption process.

Const.Name: GVS_DEFAULT
Const.Description: Use the default behavior which is to make the column as small as it can be while still accommodating all of its text. (Default)

Const.Name: GVS_HEADER
Const.Description: Make the column resize according to the size of the text in the header cell.

Const.Name: GVS_DATA
Const.Description: Make the column resize to the widest non-header cell in the column.

Const.Name: GVS_BOTH
Const.Description: Mixes both GVS_HEADER and GVS_DATA using whichever is the widest in the column.

Arg.Note: Set this to nil to use the default setting.
Set this to "" or nil to use the default key table.

Extended.Name: KeyBind
Extended.Description: This plugin makes key binding, key code association and integrated script execution simple. No more memorizing key codes or endless lines of code on different pages or separate objects. With KeyBind, creating key-script associations is simple and quick.
Extended.Author: Centauri Soldier
Extended.InstallNotes: Place the KeyBind folder in your "AutoPlay Media Studio\Plugins\Action" folder.
